1: Of David The LORD is my light and my health: whom then should I fear? the LORD is the strength of my life, for whom then should I be afraid?
2: Therefore when the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me, to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.
3: Though an host of men were laid against me, yet shall not my heart be afraid: and though there rose up war against me, yet will I put my trust in him.
4: One thing have I desired of the LORD, which I will require: namely, that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to behold the fair beauty of the LORD, and to visit his temple.
5: For in the time of trouble he hath hid me in his tabernacle, yea in the secret place of his dwelling hath he kept and set me up upon a rock of stone.
6: And now hath he lift up my head above mine enemies, that compassed me round about. Therefore will I offer in his dwelling, the oblation of thanksgiving: I will (both) sing and speak praises unto the LORD.
7: Harken unto my voice, O LORD, when I cry unto thee: have mercy upon me, and hear me.
8: My heart speaketh unto thee, my face seeketh thee, yea LORD, thy face will I seek.
9: O hide not thou thy face from me, cast not thy servant off in displeasure. Thou art my succour, leave me not, neither forsake me, O God my Saviour.
10: For my father and my mother have forsaken me, but the LORD hath taken me up.
11: Shew me thy way, O LORD, and lead me in the right path, because of mine enemies.
12: Deliver me not into the wiles of mine adversaries, for there are false witnesses risen up against me, and they imagine mischief.
13: Nevertheless I believe verily to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.
14: O tarry thou the LORD's leisure, be strong, let thine heart be of good comfort, and wait thou still for the LORD.
